intro: Hosackia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved false indigo, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Hosackia microphylla is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
